questions.question_text:
You are a Dynamics 365 for Field Service administrator for a construction company.
You need to schedule a work order for a group of resources that will work together for a set number of days, week, or months.
How should you achieve the goal without scheduling the same requirements multiple times manually by using the schedule board (or with the schedule assistant)?

Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.

After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.

You are implementing Microsoft Dynamics 365 Field Service for a health care institution. Each day, the institution receives a large number of appointment requests for pediatricians.

You have the following requirements:
• create a daily schedule for pediatricians with a frequency of 30 minutes for each slot.
• provide a full-day schedule with start times and end times.

Solution: You create a fulfillment preference with time window details with a duration of 30 minutes for the whole day, create a requirement group, and book it with the schedule assistant.

Does this meet the goal?

discussion.content: Solution: You create a fulfillment preference with interval details with a duration of 30 minutes for the whole day, associate it to a requirement, and then book the requirement with the schedule assistant.
